garlic.types¶

Implementation of types utilised internally and externally.

  • GUARD – Guard flag.

  • FAST – Fast flag.

  • STABLE – Stable flag.

  • V2DIR – V2Dir flag.

  • HSDIR – HSDir flag.

  • RUNNING – Running flag.

  • VALID – Valid flag.

class garlic.types.RelaySummary(nickname, fingerprint, addresses, running)[source]¶

Bases: garlic.types.Deserialisable

Representation of the relay summary document.

Parameters

  • nickname (str) – Relay nickname consisting of 1–19 alphanumerical characters.

  • fingerprint (str) – Relay fingerprint consisting of 40 upper-case hexadecimal characters.

  • addresses (List[str]) – Array of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses where the relay accepts onion-routing connections or which the relay used to exit to the Internet in the past 24 hours. The first address is the primary onion-routing address that the relay used to register in the network, subsequent addresses are in arbitrary order.

  • running (bool) – Boolean field saying whether this relay was listed as running in the last relay network status consensus.

Return type

None

classmethod from_json(json)[source]¶

Instantiate a summary document with JSON response from the API.

Parameters

json (dict) – Raw JSON response.

Return type

RelaySummary

  • hashed_fingerprint (str) – SHA-1 hash of the bridge fingerprint consisting of 40 upper-case hexadecimal characters.

  • running (bool) – Boolean field saying whether this bridge was listed as running in the last bridge network status.

Return type

None

class garlic.types.RelayDetailsBase(nickname, fingerprint, or_addresses, last_seen, last_changed_address_or_port, first_seen, running, consensus_weight, exit_addresses=None, dir_address=None, hibernating=None, flags=None, country=None, country_name=None, region_name=None, city_name=None, latitude=None, longitude=None, as_=None, as_name=None, verified_host_names=None, unverified_host_names=None, last_restarted=None, bandwidth_rate=None, bandwidth_burst=None, observed_bandwidth=None, advertised_bandwidth=None, exit_policy=None, exit_policy_summary=None, exit_policy_v6_summary=None, contact=None, platform=None, version=None, recommended_version=None, version_status=None, effective_family=None, alleged_family=None, indirect_family=None, consensus_weight_fraction=None, guard_probability=None, middle_probability=None, exit_probability=None, measured=None, unreachable_or_addresses=None)[source]¶

Bases: garlic.types.Deserialisable

Representation of the relay details document.

Parameters

  • nickname (None) – Potential relay nickname consisting of 1–19 alphanumerical characters.

  • fingerprint (None) – Potential relay fingerprint consisting of 40 upper-case hexadecimal characters.

  • or_addresses (None) – Potential array of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and TCP ports or port lists where the relay accepts onion-routing connections. The first address is the primary onion-routing address that the relay used to register in the network, subsequent addresses are in arbitrary order.

  • last_seen (None) – Potential UTC timestamp when this relay was last seen in a network status consensus.

  • last_changed_address_or_port (None) – Potential UTC timestamp when this relay last stopped announcing an IPv4 or IPv6 address or TCP port where it previously accepted onion-routing or directory connections.

  • first_seen (None) – Potential UTC timestamp when this relay was first seen in a network status consensus.

  • running (None) – Potential boolean field saying whether this relay was listed as running in the last relay network status consensus.

  • consensus_weight (None) – Potential weight assigned to this relay by the directory authorities that clients use in their path selection algorithm.

  • exit_addresses (Optional[List[str]]) – Array of IPv4 addresses that the relay used to exit to the Internet in the past 24 hours. py:None if array is empty.

  • dir_address (Optional[str]) – IPv4 address and TCP port where the relay accepts directory connections. py:None if the relay does not accept directory connections.

  • hibernating (Optional[bool]) – Boolean field saying whether this relay indicated that it is hibernating in its last known server descriptor. py:None if either the relay is not hibernating, or if no information is available about the hibernation status of the relay.

  • flags (Optional[List[Flag]]) – Array of relay flags that the directory authorities assigned to this relay. May be omitted if empty.

  • country (Optional[str]) – Two-letter lower-case country code as found in a GeoIP database by resolving the relay’s first onion-routing IP address. py:None if the relay IP address could not be found in the GeoIP database.

  • country_name (Optional[str]) – Country name as found in a GeoIP database by resolving the relay’s first onion-routing IP address. py:None if the relay IP address could not be found in the GeoIP database, or if the GeoIP database did not contain a country name.

  • region_name (Optional[str]) – Region name as found in a GeoIP database by resolving the relay’s first onion-routing IP address. py:None if the relay IP address could not be found in the GeoIP database, or if the GeoIP database did not contain a region name.

  • city_name (Optional[str]) – City name as found in a GeoIP database by resolving the relay’s first onion-routing IP address. py:None if the relay IP address could not be found in the GeoIP database, or if the GeoIP database did not contain a city name.

  • latitude (Optional[float]) – Latitude as found in a GeoIP database by resolving the relay’s first onion-routing IP address. py:None if the relay IP address could not be found in the GeoIP database.

  • longitude (Optional[float]) – Longitude as found in a GeoIP database by resolving the relay’s first onion-routing IP address. py:None if the relay IP address could not be found in the GeoIP database.

  • as – AS number as found in an AS database by resolving the relay’s first onion-routing IP address. AS number strings start with “AS”, followed directly by the AS number. py:None if the relay IP address could not be found in the AS database.

  • as_name (Optional[str]) – AS name as found in an AS database by resolving the relay’s first onion-routing IP address. py:None if the relay IP address could not be found in the AS database.

  • verified_host_names (Optional[List[str]]) – Host names as found in a reverse DNS lookup of the relay’s primary IP address for which a matching A record was also found. This field is updated at most once in 12 hours, unless the relay IP address changes. py:None if the relay IP address was not looked up, if no lookup request was successful yet, or if no A records were found matching the PTR records.

  • unverified_host_names (Optional[List[str]]) – Host names as found in a reverse DNS lookup of the relay’s primary IP address that for which a matching A record was not found. This field is updated at most once in 12 hours, unless the relay IP address changes. py:None if the relay IP address was not looked up, if no lookup request was successful yet, or if A records were found matching all PTR records.

  • last_restarted (Optional[datetime]) – UTC timestamp when the relay was last (re-)started. py:None if router descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • bandwidth_rate (Optional[int]) – Average bandwidth in bytes per second that this relay is willing to sustain over long periods. py:None if router descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • bandwidth_burst (Optional[int]) – Bandwidth in bytes per second that this relay is willing to sustain in very short intervals. py:None if router descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • observed_bandwidth (Optional[int]) – Bandwidth estimate in bytes per second of the capacity this relay can handle. py:None if router descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • advertised_bandwidth (Optional[int]) – Bandwidth in bytes per second that this relay is willing and capable to provide. py:None if router descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • exit_policy (Optional[List[str]]) – Array of exit-policy lines. py:None if router descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • exit_policy_summary (Optional[ExitPolicy]) – Summary version of the relay’s exit policy.

  • exit_policy_v6_summary (Optional[ExitPolicy]) – Summary version of the relay’s IPv6 exit policy.

  • contact (Optional[str]) – Contact address of the relay operator. py:None if empty or if descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • platform (Optional[str]) – Platform string containing operating system and Tor version details. py:None if empty or if descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • version (Optional[str]) – Tor software version without leading “Tor” as reported by the directory authorities in the “v” line of the consensus. py None if either the directory authorities or the relay did not report which version the relay runs or if the relay runs an alternative Tor implementation.

  • recommended_version (Optional[bool]) – Boolean field saying whether the Tor software version of this relay is recommended by the directory authorities or not. py:None if either the directory authorities did not recommend versions, or the relay did not report which version it runs.

  • version_status (Optional[str]) –

    Status of the Tor software version of the relay based on the versions recommended by the directory authorities. Possible version statuses are:

    • ”recommended” if a version is listed as recommended;

    • ”experimental” if a version is newer than every recommended version;

    • ”obsolete” if a version is older than every recommended version;

    • ”new in series” if a version has other recommended versions with the same first three components, and the version is newer than all such recommended versions, but it is not newer than every recommended version;

    • ”unrecommended” if none of the above conditions hold.

    None if either the directory authorities did not recommend versions, or the bridge did not report which version it runs.

  • effective_family (Optional[List[str]]) – Array of fingerprints of relays that are in an effective, mutual family relationship with this relay. These relays are part of this relay’s family and they consider this relay to be part of their family. Always contains the relay’s own fingerprint. class:py:None if the descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • alleged_family (Optional[List[str]]) – Array of fingerprints of relays that are not in an effective, mutual family relationship with this relay. These relays are part of this relay’s family but they don’t consider this relay to be part of their family. py:None if empty or if descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • indirect_family (Optional[List[str]]) – Array of fingerprints of relays that are not in an effective, mutual family relationship with this relay but that can be reached by following effective, mutual family relationships starting at this relay. py:None if empty or if descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • consensus_weight_fraction (Optional[int]) – Fraction of this relay’s consensus weight compared to the sum of all consensus weights in the network. This fraction is a very rough approximation of the probability of this relay to be selected by clients. py:None if the relay is not running.

  • guard_probability (Optional[float]) – Probability of this relay to be selected for the guard position. py:None if the relay is not running, or the consensus does not contain bandwidth weights.

  • middle_probability (Optional[float]) – Probability of this relay to be selected for the middle position. py:None if the relay is not running, or the consensus does not contain bandwidth weights.

  • exit_probability (Optional[float]) – Probability of this relay to be selected for the exit position. py:None if the relay is not running, or the consensus does not contain bandwidth weights.

  • measured (Optional[bool]) – Boolean field saying whether the consensus weight of this relay is based on a threshold of 3 or more measurements by Tor bandwidth authorities. py:None if the network status consensus containing this relay does not contain measurement information.

  • unreachable_or_addresses (Optional[List[str]]) – Array of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and TCP ports or port lists where the relay claims in its descriptor to accept onion-routing connections but that the directory authorities failed to confirm as reachable. Contains only additional addresses of a relay that are found unreachable and only as long as a minority of directory authorities performs reachability tests on these additional addresses. Relays with an unreachable primary address are not included in the network status consensus and excluded entirely. Likewise, relays with unreachable additional addresses tested by a majority of directory authorities are not included in the network status consensus and excluded here, too. If at any point network status votes will be added to the processing, relays with unreachable addresses will be included here. Addresses are in arbitrary order. IPv6 hex characters are all lower-case. py:None if empty.

  • as_ (Optional[str]) –

Return type

None

abstract classmethod from_json(json)¶

Deserialise JSON into an instance of the implementing class.

Parameters

json (dict) – Raw JSON response.

class garlic.types.RelayDetails(nickname, fingerprint, or_addresses, last_seen, last_changed_address_or_port, first_seen, running, consensus_weight, exit_addresses=None, dir_address=None, hibernating=None, flags=None, country=None, country_name=None, region_name=None, city_name=None, latitude=None, longitude=None, as_=None, as_name=None, verified_host_names=None, unverified_host_names=None, last_restarted=None, bandwidth_rate=None, bandwidth_burst=None, observed_bandwidth=None, advertised_bandwidth=None, exit_policy=None, exit_policy_summary=None, exit_policy_v6_summary=None, contact=None, platform=None, version=None, recommended_version=None, version_status=None, effective_family=None, alleged_family=None, indirect_family=None, consensus_weight_fraction=None, guard_probability=None, middle_probability=None, exit_probability=None, measured=None, unreachable_or_addresses=None)[source]¶

  • running (bool) – Boolean field saying whether this relay was listed as running in the last relay network status consensus.

class garlic.types.PartialRelayDetails(nickname=None, fingerprint=None, or_addresses=None, last_seen=None, last_changed_address_or_port=None, first_seen=None, running=None, consensus_weight=None, exit_addresses=None, dir_address=None, hibernating=None, flags=None, country=None, country_name=None, region_name=None, city_name=None, latitude=None, longitude=None, as_=None, as_name=None, verified_host_names=None, unverified_host_names=None, last_restarted=None, bandwidth_rate=None, bandwidth_burst=None, observed_bandwidth=None, advertised_bandwidth=None, exit_policy=None, exit_policy_summary=None, exit_policy_v6_summary=None, contact=None, platform=None, version=None, recommended_version=None, version_status=None, effective_family=None, alleged_family=None, indirect_family=None, consensus_weight_fraction=None, guard_probability=None, middle_probability=None, exit_probability=None, measured=None, unreachable_or_addresses=None)[source]¶

class garlic.types.BridgeDetailsBase(nickname, hashed_fingerprint, or_addresses, last_seen, first_seen, running, flags=None, last_restarted=None, advertised_bandwidth=None, platform=None, version=None, recommended_version=None, version_status=None, transports=None, bridgedb_distribtor=None)[source]¶

Bases: garlic.types.Deserialisable

Representation of the bridge details document.

Parameters

  • nickname (str) – Bridge nickname consisting of 1–19 alphanumerical characters.

  • hashed_fingerprint (str) – SHA-1 hash of the bridge fingerprint consisting of 40 upper-case hexadecimal characters.

  • or_addresses (List[str]) – Array of sanitized IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and TCP ports or port lists where the bridge accepts onion-routing connections. The first address is the primary onion-routing address that the bridge used to register in the network, subsequent addresses are in arbitrary order.

  • last_seen (datetime) – UTC timestamp when the bridge was last seen in a bridge network status.

  • first_seen (datetime) – UTC timestamp when the bridge was first seen in a bridge network status.

  • running (bool) – Boolean field saying whether the bridge was listed as running in the last bridge network status.

  • flags (Optional[List[Flag]]) – Array of relay flags that the bridge authority assigned to the bridge. None if empty.

  • last_restarted (Optional[datetime]) – UTC timestamp when the bridge was last (re-)started. None if router descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • advertised_bandwidth (Optional[int]) – Bandwidth in bytes per second that the bridge is willing and capable to provide. The bandwidth value is the minimum of bandwidth_rate, bandwidth_burst, and observed_bandwidth. None if router descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • platform (Optional[str]) – Platform string containing operating system and Tor version details. None if not provided by the bridge or if descriptor containing this information cannot be found.

  • version (Optional[str]) – Tor software version without leading “Tor” as reported by the bridge in the “platform” line of its server descriptor. None if not provided by the bridge, if the descriptor containing this information cannot be found, or if the bridge runs an alternative Tor implementation.

  • recommended_version (Optional[bool]) – Boolean field saying whether the Tor software version of the bridge is recommended by the directory authorities or not. None if either the directory authorities did not recommend versions, or the bridge did not report which version it runs.

  • version_status (Optional[str]) –

    Status of the Tor software version of the bridge based on the versions recommended by the directory authorities. Possible version statuses are:

    • ”recommended” if a version is listed as recommended;

    • ”experimental” if a version is newer than every recommended version;

    • ”obsolete” if a version is older than every recommended version;

    • ”new in series” if a version has other recommended versions with the same first three components, and the version is newer than all such recommended versions, but it is not newer than every recommended version;

    • ”unrecommended” if none of the above conditions hold.

    None if either the directory authorities did not recommend versions, or the bridge did not report which version it runs.

  • transports (Optional[List[str]]) – Array of (pluggable) transport names supported by the bridge.

  • bridgedb_distributor – BridgeDB distributor that the bridge is currently assigned to.

  • bridgedb_distribtor (Optional[str]) –

Return type

None

classmethod from_json(json)[source]¶

Instantiate a bridge details document with JSON response from the API.

Parameters

class garlic.types.GraphHistory(first, last, interval, factor, values, count=None)[source]¶

Bases: garlic.types.Deserialisable

Representation of the graph history document.

Parameters

  • first (datetime) – UTC timestamp of the interval midpoint of the first interval.

  • last (datetime) – UTC timestamp of the interval midpoint of the last interval.

  • interval (int) – Time interval between two datapoints in seconds.

  • factor (float) – Factor by which subsequent data values need to be multiplied to obtain original values.

  • count (Optional[int]) – Number of provided data points.

  • values (List[int]) – Array of normalized values between 0 and 999. May contain null values. Contains at least two subsequent non-null values to enable drawling of line graphs.

denormalise()[source]¶

Denormalise values, in place, by multiplyling each value by self.factor.

Return type

None

classmethod from_json(json)[source]¶

Instantiate graph history document with JSON response from the API.

Parameters

json (dict) – Raw JSON response.

Returns

the GraphHistory instance.

class garlic.types.RelayBandwidth(fingerprint, write_history=None, read_history=None)[source]¶

Bases: garlic.types.BandwidthBase

Representation of the bridge bandwidth document.

Parameters

  • fingerprint (str) – Relay fingerprint consisting of 40 upper-case hexadecimal characters.

  • write_history (Optional[Dict[str, GraphHistory]]) – Historical observation of the relay’s written bytes per second. None if the relay did not provide bandwidth histories on the required level of detail.

  • read_history (Optional[Dict[str, GraphHistory]]) – Historical observation of the relay’s read bytes per second. None if the relay did not provide bandwidth histories on the required level of detail.

Bases: garlic.types.BandwidthBase

Representation of the bridge bandwidth document.

Parameters

  • write_history (Optional[Dict[str, GraphHistory]]) – Historical observation of the bridge’s written bytes. None if the relay did not provide bandwidth histories on the required level of detail.

  • read_history (Optional[Dict[str, GraphHistory]]) – Historical observation of the bridges’s read bytes. None if the relay did not provide bandwidth histories on the required level of detail.

class garlic.types.RelayWeight(fingerprint, consensus_weight_fraction=None, guard_probability=None, middle_probability=None, exit_probability=None, consensus_weight=None)[source]¶

Bases: garlic.types.Deserialisable

Representation of the relay weight document.

Parameters

  • fingerprint (str) – Relay fingerprint consisting of 40 upper-case hexadecimal characters.

  • consensus_weight_fraction (Optional[Dict[str, GraphHistory]]) – Historical observation of the relay’s consensus weight compared to the sum of all consensus weights in the network.

  • guard_probability (Optional[Dict[str, GraphHistory]]) – Historical observation of the the relay’s probability to be selected for guard position.

  • middle_probability (Optional[Dict[str, GraphHistory]]) – Historical observation of the the relay’s probability to be selected for middle position.

  • exit_probability (Optional[Dict[str, GraphHistory]]) – Historical observation of the the relay’s probability to be selected for exit position.

  • consensus_weight (Optional[Dict[str, GraphHistory]]) – Historical observation of the absolute consensus weight of the relay.

Parameters

json (dict) – Raw JSON response.

Returns

RelayWeight instance.

class garlic.types.ResponseBase(version, relays_published, bridges_published, relays, bridges, next_major_version_scheduled=None, build_revision=None, relays_skipped=0, relays_truncated=0, bridges_skipped=0, bridges_truncated=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Representation of the API response.

Parameters

  • version (str) – Onionoo protocol version string.

  • next_major_version_scheduled (Optional[datetime]) – UTC date when the next major protocol version is scheduled to be deployed. None if no major protocol changes are planned.

  • build_revision (Optional[str]) – Git revision of the Onionoo instance’s software used to write the response. None if unknown.

  • relays_published (datetime) – UTC timestamp when the last known relay network status consensus started being valid.

  • relays_skipped (int) – Number of skipped relays as requested by a positive “offset” parameter value.

  • relays (None) – Potentially deserialised RelayDescriptor objects.

  • relays_truncated (int) – Number of truncated relays as requested by a positive “limit” parameter value.

  • bridges_skipped (int) – Number of skipped bridges as requested by a positive “offset” parameter value.

  • bridges (None) – Potentially deserialised BridgeDescriptor objects.

  • bridges_truncated (int) – Number of truncated bridges as requested by a positive “limit” parameter value.

  • bridges_published (datetime.datetime) –

Return type

None
